intro: Tiquilia galapagoa, commonly known as the Galapagos tiquilia, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a low, sprawling habit. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and covered in fine hairs. Tiquilia galapagoa plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the unique flora of the Galápagos.
